author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Admits Mattis’ View On Torture For Terror Suspects Surprised Him
text:
Mexican Peso Tumbles Following President Nieto’s Cancellation Of Meeting With Trump 
Although Trump said he believed that torture on terrorists can be effective, he said Wednesday that he will defer to Mattis and CIA Director Mike Pompeo as to how the U.S. interrogates individuals who have information that can help America defeat terrorism. 
Muir asked Trump, “The last president — President Obama — said the U.S. does not torture. Will you say that?” 
“Well, I have a general who I have great respect for, Gen. Mattis, who said — I was a little surprised — who said he’s not a believer in torture,” Trump said. Advertisement - story continues below 
Mattis and Trump had clearly discussed the subject. 
During a November 2016 interview with the New York Times, Trump implied Mattis’ views on waterboarding might reshape his own. 
“General Mattis is a strong, highly dignified man. I met with him at length and I asked him that question. I said, ‘What do you think of waterboarding?'” Trump said then. 
“He said — I was surpr i sed — he said, ‘I’ve never found it to be useful.’ He said, ‘I’ve always found, give me a pack of cigarettes and a couple of beers and I do better with that than I do with torture.'” Advertisement - story continues below
